segments.en: Linked Discourses 22

segments.pli: 10. Pupphavagga
segments.en: 10. Flowers

segments.pli: 94. Pupphasutta
segments.en: 94. Flowers

segments.pli: Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, lokova mayā vivadati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I don’t argue with the world; it’s the world that argues with me.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.
segments.en: When your speech is in line with the teaching you don’t argue with anyone in the world.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, natthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, ahampi taṃ ‘natthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: What the astute agree on as not existing, I too say does not exist.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, ahampi taṃ ‘atthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: What the astute agree on as existing, I too say exists.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, natthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, yamahaṃ ‘natthī’ti vadāmi?
segments.en: And what do the astute agree on as not existing, which I too say does not exist?

segments.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ natthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ; ahampi taṃ ‘natthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: Form that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable.

segments.en: Feeling …

segments.en: Perception …

segments.pli: saṅkhārā …
segments.en: Choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ natthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ; ahampi taṃ ‘natthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: Consciousness that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable.

segments.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, natthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ; ahampi taṃ ‘natthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: This is what the astute agree on as not existing, which I too say does not exist.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, yamahaṃ ‘atthī’ti vadāmi?
segments.en: And what do the astute agree on as existing, which I too say exists?

segments.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ; ahampi taṃ ‘atthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: Form that is impermanent, suffering, and perishable.

segments.en: Consciousness that is impermanent, suffering, and perishable.

segments.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ; ahampi taṃ ‘atthī’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: This is what the astute agree on as existing, which I too say exists.

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti;
segments.en: There is a temporal phenomenon in the world that the Realized One understands and comprehends.

segments.pli: abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.
segments.en: Then he explains, teaches, asserts, establishes, clarifies, analyzes, and reveals it.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti?
segments.en: And what is that temporal phenomenon in the world?

segments.pli: Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti.
segments.en: Form is a temporal phenomenon in the world that the Realized One understands and comprehends.

segments.pli: Abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.
segments.en: Then he explains, teaches, asserts, establishes, clarifies, analyzes, and reveals it.

segments.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, tathāgatena evaṃ ācikkhiyamāne desiyamāne paññapiyamāne paṭṭhapiyamāne vivariyamāne vibhajiyamāne uttānīkariyamāne na jānāti na passati tamahaṃ, bhikkhave, bālaṃ puthujjanaṃ andhaṃ acakkhukaṃ ajānantaṃ apassantaṃ kinti karomi.
segments.en: This being so, what can I do about a foolish ordinary person, blind and sightless, who does not know or see?

segments.pli: Vedanā, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo … pe …
segments.en: Feeling …

segments.pli: saññā, bhikkhave …
segments.en: Perception …

segments.en: Choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti.
segments.en: Consciousness is a temporal phenomenon in the world that the Realized One understands and comprehends.

segments.pli: Abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.
segments.en: Then he explains, teaches, asserts, establishes, clarifies, analyzes, and reveals it.

segments.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, tathāgatena evaṃ ācikkhiyamāne desiyamāne paññapiyamāne paṭṭhapiyamāne vivariyamāne vibhajiyamāne uttānīkariyamāne na jānāti na passati tamahaṃ, bhikkhave, bālaṃ puthujjanaṃ andhaṃ acakkhukaṃ ajānantaṃ apassantaṃ kinti karomi.
segments.en: This being so, what can I do about a foolish ordinary person, blind and sightless, who does not know or see?

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uppalaṃ vā padumaṃ vā puṇḍarīkaṃ vā udake jātaṃ udake saṃvaḍḍhaṃ udakā accuggamma ṭhāti anupalittaṃ udakena;
segments.en: Suppose there was a blue water lily, or a pink or white lotus. Though it sprouted and grew in the water, it would rise up above the water and stand with no water clinging to it.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato loke jāto loke saṃvaḍḍho lokaṃ abhibhuyya viharati anupalitto lokenā”ti.
segments.en: In the same way, though I was born and grew up in the world, I live having mastered the world, and the world does not cling to me.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha doesn’t dispute with the world; the world disputes with him. He has understood the five aggregates and explains them. Like a lotus, he was born in the swamp, but rises above it.
